description: Conversion of dwelling into eight self-contained flats; two storey front extension, part two storey rear extension, part two storey side extension, front/side and rear roof extension, provision of three car parking space, associated refuse and cycle storage
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s): 45Ruislip/PL01, 45Ruislip/PL02, 45Ruislip/PL03, 45Ruislip/PL06D, 45Ruislip/PL07G, 45Ruislip/PL08E, 45Ruislip/PL09B, 45Ruislip/PL10A, Daylight & Sunlight Report October 2018.
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, in the interest of proper planning.
| All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) Policies 7.4 and 7B; London Plan (2016) policies 7.4 and 7.6; and National Planning Policy Framework (2018).

| The refuse and recycling storage facilities hereby approved shall be kept locked, and implemented and operational before the first occupation of any part of the development, and permanently retained thereafter.

Reason:  In the interests of the adequate disposal, storage and collection of waste and recycling, in accordance with policies with policies 3.5 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), and policy 5.17 of the London Plan (2016).

| The cycle parking facilities for a minimum of 12 cycle spaces hereby approved shall be implemented and operational before the first use of any part of the development hereby approved, and permanently retained thereafter, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  The cycle parking shall be provided and located in a secure undercover and lockable compound.

Reason: In the interests of highway and pedestrian safety in accordance with policies 1.1 f of the Ealing Development Strategy (2012), policy 6.9 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2018).
| The private garden amenity areas shown on drawing reference: 45Ruislip/PL07G, shall be laid out prior to first occupation of any of the units hereby permitted and retained in perpetuity thereafter.
Reason: To ensure that there is adequate provision of amenity space within the site in accordance with Policy 7D of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013).

| Before the development hereby permitted is first occupied, the side facing dormer windows on the east and west elevations shall be glazed with obscured glass, which shall be non-opening to an internal height of 1.7m, and shall be maintained for the life of the development unless alternative arrangements are approved in writing by the local planning authority.

Reason: To safeguard the amenities and privacy of the occupiers of adjoining properties, in accordance with the National Planning Policy Framework (2018), policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan 2013, policy 1.1 (g) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012 and policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2016).

| Before the development hereby permitted is first occupied, the side facing windows on the east and west elevations shall be glazed with obscured glass, which shall be non-opening to an internal height of 1.7m,and shall be maintained for the life of the development unless alternative arrangements are approved in writing by the local planning authority.

Reason: To safeguard the amenities and privacy of the occupiers of adjoining properties, in accordance with the National Planning Policy Framework (2018), policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan 2013, policy 1.1 (g) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012 and policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2016).
| Drainage shall be provided within the site such that surface water from the vehicular access does not drain into the public highway.

Reason: To reduce the possibility of surface water from the site being deposited in the highway causing dangers to road users in accordance with policies 1.1 f & 8 g of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), SPG 10, policies 6.11 and 6.14 of the London Plan (2016), the National Planning Policy Framework (2018).

| The three car parking spaces shall be provided in accordance with the car parking spaces indicated on drawing reference 45Ruislip/PL07G prior to the first occupation of the development permitted and retained thereafter.

Reason: In the interests of highway and pedestrian safety in accordance with policies 1.1 f & 2.8 g of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 6.13, & 6.14 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2018).

| Before the development hereby permitted is first occupied the developer shall enter into a section 106 agreement with the local planning authority to ensure that future residents of the development are provided with 3 years membership to a local car club service, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local Planning Authority.

Reason: To ensure that the surrounding streets are not subject to parking stress or danger or nuisance from inappropriate on-street parking or waiting as a result of the proposed development in accordance with policy 6.13 of the Development Management Plan Document (2013) and Supplementary Planning Document 3 (Low Car Housing in Controlled Parking Zones).

| Details shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to first occupation, for the installation in each dwelling of an ultra-low NOx boiler with maximum NOx emissions of less than 0.030 g/kWh.  The works, as approved, shall be completed prior to occupation and thereafter permanently retained.
Reason: In order to comply with Ealing Council's commitment to being an Air Quality Exemplar Borough and policy 7.14 of the London Plan (2016).
